content:
Edited contribution.
Added a space in Input -> line 2 -> between "throwsas" for "throws as"

Swapped test 3 with validator 3 so that there is a test case that involves rounding visible to the clasher.

You need to specify that percentages are being floored/truncated. The example in "Output" is not clear because "0,654 becomes 65" could still be rounding to the nearest percentage, rather than truncating.

This clash is very unfair in its current state and like others have said the tests/validators are poorly defined/matched.
Same issue, Validator 3 is causing 75% scores because rounding/truncation is not stated nor needed in any test case.
Validator 3 needs to be modified, or at least have a similar testcase, I got a 75% because of it. Look at wala's comment.

Validator 3 is the only one where the result is a float and needs to be rounded.
Test 3 should also be a float.
Look at all the 75% :
https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/2675419d7ce8b5d4b0d573b24b4b3d61f36253d

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This exercise is pretty okey, some maths, some logic from tabletop RPG that I love. Good for beginners in problem solving.
Seems good for me. Problem is quite easy and relatable for much tabletop games which is really fun.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Question asked is good for beginner and for intermediates.
I am able to solve that problem within limited time. and found its fun.
that is sure interesting question, little maths and little programming, overall nice.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That's a good idea of game
Not so long, not so difficult. 
Fun

* Input section, line 1: Please change "number" to "integer".

* Input section, line 2: Please specify that the throws are space-separated integers.

* Please move the constraint to Output section, as it is an output requirement, not a constraint on the inputs that will be tested.

* In the example, why is the answer 10? Should the probability be calculated as 2 (4 appears 2 times) divided by 10 = 20% instead? Have I misunderstood anything?

I changed what you suggested in the input and output sections.

For the example, I missed a couple parentheses and didn't see it until you brought it up but it is now changed and should be working as intended.

Thanks for the feedback
